result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L Wolff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health assessment/evaluation and follow through.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victims, any of their family members or their residences listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant is not to be in possession or use of any firearms during the period of probation.  Defendant has 1 week to facilitate that.
Court orders the pellet gun seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding law enforment agency.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark L Wolff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mark L Wolff in court with attorney Peter J. Plaushines. 
Restitution has been paid in full.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Victims presented statements to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims any of their family members or their residence listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Health assessment/evaluation and follow through.
Not to be in possession or use of any firearms during the period of probation - Defendant has 1 week to facilitate that.

Court orders the pellet gun seized is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding law enforcement agency.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered, including cover letter, filed by Atty. Plaushines.

Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint his family and residence.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms except for the deer hunting season and only for that purpose.
Defendant Mark L Wolff in court with attorney Peter J. Plaushines.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
